message.content:
cs.SD, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.SI, cs.NE 

The paper proposes a novel recurrent neural network architecture for speech separation, which falls under the category of signal processing and machine learning. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.SD (Sound), followed by cs.CL (Computation and Language) as the paper deals with speech separation. The paper also discusses the interpretability and generalization of the proposed architecture, which suggests that it may fall under the sub-categories of cs.LG (Learning) and cs.SI (Systems and Control). Finally, the paper uses iterative thresholding and NMF, which are optimization techniques, indicating that it may also belong to the sub-category of cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing).
